required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application CT and MRI in Cerebral Venous Sinus Thrombosis
clinical_study.official_title: the Application CT and MRI in the Diagnosis of Cerebral Venous Sinus Thrombosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT) is a rare disease, and with poor prognosis. Computed tomography (CT) andmagnetic resonance imaging (MRI) are the most commonly used image modalities for patients with non-specific neurologic symptoms. We are going to assess the accuracy of CT and MRI in the differential diagnosis of CVT and cerebral venous sinus thrombosis (CVST).

primary_outcome.description: specificity and sensitivity of CT in the diagnosis of cerebral venous sinus thrombosis
specificity and sensitivity of MRI in the diagnosis of cerebral venous sinus thrombosis

study_pop.textblock: All the patients with the diagnosis of cerebral venous thrombosis or cerebral venous sinus thrombosis at admission were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
A. The patients were diagnosed with cerebral venous thrombosis or cerebral venous sinus thrombosis; B. The patients completed at least cranial CT or MRI examination upon admission;C. The patients complete at least one of the CTV, MRV or DSA examination.
Exclusion Criteria:
A. Patients with severe cardiopulmonary insufficiency;B. Patients lost to follow-up;C. Patients with incomplete access to imaging data;D. Patients with cerebral venous sinus thrombosis that was not diagnosed at discharge.

facility.name: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
